findings.title: Admin/Owner Privileges can be misused
findings.description: The admin/owner of JulPadToken has various privileges over the smart contracts which can be misused intentionally or unintentionally.

findings.title: MINTER address can mint any amount of tokens
findings.description: The MINTER account can mint any number of tokens to any ethereum address.

findings.title: MINTER role can be given to any address/account
findings.description: The tokenOwner and MINTER of the contract has the right to give a MINTER role to any ethereum address.

findings.title: PAUSER role can be given to any address/account
findings.description: The tokenOwner and PAUSER of the contract has the right to give a PAUSER role to any ethereum address.

findings.title: Owner role can be given to any address/account
findings.description: The tokenOwner of the contract has the right to give an Owner role to any ethereum address.

findings.title: Ether can get locked in the JulPadToken contract
findings.description: The payable fallback function can be used to send Ether to the JulPadToken contract which cannot be recovered.
findings.location: payable fallback function in JulPadToken contract

findings.title: No need to reserve storage space in the contract
findings.description: There is no need to reserve storage space for upgrading the contract logic as there is no such code present.

findings.title: Redundant logic for contractâ€™s ownership present
findings.description: The JulPadToken contract has redundant implementation of ownership logic using the tokenOwner variable and setOwner() function.

findings.title: Functions should be declared as external
findings.description: Public functions can be declared as external to reduce gas costs.
